body: Add some missing build targets and split the CMakeLists.txt file for better readability. based on: #2100 --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/2101)

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@
+# For coverage tests
+target_compile_definitions(toxcore_static PUBLIC "FUZZING_BUILD_MODE_UNSAFE_FOR_PRODUCTION")
+
+# Override network and random functions
+add_library(fuzz_adapter fuzz_adapter.c)
+
+set(LIBFUZZER_LINKER_FLAGS)
+if (CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ID STREQUAL "Clang")
+    set(LIBFUZZER_LINKER_FLAGS "-fsanitize=fuzzer")

comment_data.body: You should probably enable this in some CI configuration(s) to make sure it doesn't break in the CMake build at some point in the future.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -112,11 +112,40 @@ if(USE_STDERR_LOGGER)
   add_definitions(-DUSE_STDERR_LOGGER=1)
 endif()
 
-option(NON_HERMETIC_TESTS "Whether to build and run tests that depend on an internet connection" OFF)
+option(BUILD_MISC_TESTS "Build additional tests and utilities" OFF)
+option(BUILD_FUN_UTILS "Build addtional just for fun utilities" OFF)

comment_data.body: I checked, and `BUILD_MISC_TESTS` from which I derived this, aren't built either, should I enable both in cmake-linux?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -112,11 +112,40 @@ if(USE_STDERR_LOGGER)
   add_definitions(-DUSE_STDERR_LOGGER=1)
 endif()
 
-option(NON_HERMETIC_TESTS "Whether to build and run tests that depend on an internet connection" OFF)
+option(BUILD_MISC_TESTS "Build additional tests and utilities" OFF)
+option(BUILD_FUN_UTILS "Build addtional just for fun utilities" OFF)

comment_data.body: Enabled it in CircleCI ASAN build.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -112,11 +112,40 @@ if(USE_STDERR_LOGGER)
   add_definitions(-DUSE_STDERR_LOGGER=1)
 endif()
 
-option(NON_HERMETIC_TESTS "Whether to build and run tests that depend on an internet connection" OFF)
+option(BUILD_MISC_TESTS "Build additional tests and utilities" OFF)
+option(BUILD_FUN_UTILS "Build addtional just for fun utilities" OFF)

@@ -114,11 +111,41 @@ if(USE_STDERR_LOGGER)
   add_definitions(-DUSE_STDERR_LOGGER=1)
 endif()
 
-option(NON_HERMETIC_TESTS "Whether to build and run tests that depend on an internet connection" OFF)
+option(BUILD_MISC_TESTS "Build additional tests and utilities" OFF)
+option(BUILD_FUN_UTILS "Build addtional just for fun utilities" OFF)

comment_data.body: Since you're not looking for libconfig in this file, I'd probably yoink this into the parent CMakeLists and only add_subdir if it's found.
It's pretty surprising that this is set here and not where the toxcore target is created.
I put this here, since this should really only ever be used when building the fuzzers.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -114,11 +111,41 @@ if(USE_STDERR_LOGGER)
   add_definitions(-DUSE_STDERR_LOGGER=1)
 endif()
 
-option(NON_HERMETIC_TESTS "Whether to build and run tests that depend on an internet connection" OFF)
+option(BUILD_MISC_TESTS "Build additional tests and utilities" OFF)
+option(BUILD_FUN_UTILS "Build addtional just for fun utilities" OFF)

comment_data.body: Yeah, but this is not where I'd intuitively look if I wanted wanted to know how toxcore_static is built, even when using fuzzing. :x I'd expect this to be together with the rest of toxcore cmake behind a fuzzer if(), but I'm not going to block on this.
Ok, then I'll leave it where it is, because this is really specific to the fuzzer.
